title: SKT1 Is Like The Old Pokemon Dragon Type
body: You can't defeat SKT1 unless it's another korean team, but time came to where the fairy type was introduced and it's only purpose was to counter dragon type. Let's hope C9 is that fairy type and wins worlds for NA. All hail C9 the comeback kings.

replies.body: What about Ice? They counter Dragon

> [{quoted}](name=DErpMAstEr651,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=APAhcKhA,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-10-11T03:32:34.539+0000)
>
> What about Ice? They counter Dragon

They do 2x damage to Dragon-Types, but Ice-Types are usually statistically awful and DON'T have Dragon resistance for whatever reason.

Fairy was, unfortunately, necessary to put Dragon-Types in check. But with the addition of Fairy-Types, it brought both Dragon-Types AS WELL AS ITSELF DOWN, with the exception. Fairy-Types are rarely run, to my knowledge at least, (exception: Gardevoir is so good, just get a Safeguard support in a Double-Battle and she's going to wreck face) and Dragon-Types are now rarely run in FEAR of the possible Fairy-Type/M Gardevoir counter-team.

(Also, side opinion, Sylveon is the worst Eeveelution, IMO. Concept was fine to introduce the new type, but the design is really bad in comparison to something like Umbreon, Flareon, Espeon, and pretty much every other Eeveelution. THOSE Eeveelutions are fairly simplistic and straight-forward in their design while still being extremely charming because they all evolve from the same cute-and-cuddly Eevee. Glaceon and Leafeon were less simplistic, but still perfectly fine and not overkill. Line up all the Eeveelutions, INCLUDING an Eevee, and compare them. Sylveon sticks out like a sore, infected thumb among them.)

I have never played X/Y, mainly cause I didn't have 3DS. So I never did experience Sylveon, I do know that it was used in some creepy pictures for pokemon. Also, I do not understand this whole getting perfect stats thing with pokemon these days. I just grab a few that I think look cool and that is my team.

TL;DR; Pokemon get stats when you breed them, and you can force them form the parents to give perfect stats from a parent to child. Pokemon give stats when you kill them, kill specfic pokemon x number of times depending on what you want your 2-3 best stats to be.

> [{quoted}](name=Eevee Girl Alex,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=APAhcKhA,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-10-11T04:00:13.997+0000)
>
> They do 2x damage to Dragon-Types, but Ice-Types are usually statistically awful and DON'T have Dragon resistance for whatever reason.

Two of the strongest dragons in OU have a 4x weakness to ice though: Garchomp and Dragonite. Altaria has one too before it Mega evolves, so if you hit it on the switch you're going to devastate it. Weavile, Kyurem-Black, and Mamoswine are strong Ice-types in OU, and some non-ice types, such as Starmie, can also run Ice moves.

> Fairy was, unfortunately, necessary to put Dragon-Types in check. But with the addition of Fairy-Types, it brought both Dragon-Types AS WELL AS ITSELF DOWN, with the exception. Fairy-Types are rarely run, to my knowledge at least[...]

Clefable is incredibly strong, as are Mega-Altaria, Azumarill, and Meda-Diancie. Fairy type is one of the best defensive types in the game, with only two weaknesses: Steel and Poison. Fairy types alone have made some Pokémon bring Poison moves for coverage. 

> (Also, side opinion, Sylveon is the worst Eeveelution, IMO. 

Perhaps from a design standpoint (although all Eeveelutions are pretty good looking, so it doesn't say much), but it's the strongest Eeveelution from a gameplay point of view. It's the only one that's currently decent in OU, after all.

Note that I only care about singles. I'm not really a fan of doubles or triples.

Garchomp is still strong in OU? I haven't played OU since garchomp was ubers so please bare with me. He's almost never used in vgc. Also, umbreon is actually strong in ou as a pivot ;*(. One of the only pokemon with access to wish/heal bell along with foul play.

> [{quoted}](name=epicz753,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=APAhcKhA,comment-id=0003000000040000,timestamp=2015-10-11T17:40:29.318+0000)
>
> Garchomp is still strong in OU? I haven't played OU since garchomp was ubers so please bare with me. He's almost never used in vgc. Also, umbreon is actually strong in ou as a pivot ;*(. One of the only pokemon with access to wish/heal bell along with foul play.

Garchomp is A+ in the OU viability thread on Smogon, so I'd assume it's pretty strong, yes. Umbreon is not ranked at all in OU, although perhaps they're underestimating it.

Garchomp is apparently tier 3 in Doubles. Two different meta games, I suppose.

I'm a vgc player so I don't know shit.
Anyway, when I did play OU, I always used umbreon even though nobody ever wanted to use him ;*(. Umbreon = best eeveelution.

> [{quoted}](name=epicz753,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=APAhcKhA,comment-id=000300000004000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-11T18:07:41.273+0000)
>
> I'm a vgc player so I don't know shit.
> Anyway, when I did play OU, I always used umbreon even though nobody ever wanted to use him ;*(. Umbreon = best eeveelution.

Perhaps you should try some UU, Umbreon has a solid B+ rank there. It faces some stiff competition with Florges (A+) who fills a similar role, though.
Umbreon has access to physical bulk though.

> [{quoted}](name=Sylian,realm=EUW,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=APAhcKhA,comment-id=000300000004,timestamp=2015-10-11T08:54:25.295+0000)
>
> Two of the strongest dragons in OU have a 4x weakness to ice though: Garchomp and Dragonite. Altaria has one too before it Mega evolves, so if you hit it on the switch you're going to devastate it. Weavile, Kyurem-Black, and Mamoswine are strong Ice-types in OU, and some non-ice types, such as Starmie, can also run Ice moves.
> 
> Clefable is incredibly strong, as are Mega-Altaria, Azumarill, and Meda-Diancie. Fairy type is one of the best defensive types in the game, with only two weaknesses: Steel and Poison. Fairy types alone have made some Pokémon bring Poison moves for coverage. 
> 
> Perhaps from a design standpoint (although all Eeveelutions are pretty good looking, so it doesn't say much), but it's the strongest Eeveelution from a gameplay point of view. It's the only one that's currently decent in OU, after all.
> 
> Note that I only care about singles. I'm not really a fan of doubles or triples.

I like to run a Weavile with Ice Shard, Ice Punch, Counter, and Night Slash with a Focus Sash. He can normally take care of most dragons and other physical sweepers if I'm lucky.

> [{quoted}](name=InsertCleverNckn,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=APAhcKhA,comment-id=0003000000040001,timestamp=2015-10-11T20:40:37.813+0000)
>
> I like to run a Weavile with Ice Shard, Ice Punch, Counter, and Night Slash with a Focus Sash. He can normally take care of most dragons and other physical sweepers if I'm lucky.

You should probably switch Night Slash for Knock Off, Knock Off will do far more damage on the first hit, and it'll still do more damage in total after two hits (unless the crit chance from Night Slash pays off). Besides that, making them lose an item can be really valuable.

You might want to consider Icicle Crash over Ice Punch for some extra damage. You'd lose some accuracy but gain quite a bit of damage and a 30% flinch chance.
But Dragonite's Marvel Scale. :O
I love Sylveon D:
Why would you play a dragon type when you have mega kangeskhan with sucker punch, and earthquake?

> [{quoted}](name=The Giratina,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=APAhcKhA,comment-id=000300000006,timestamp=2015-10-11T12:32:48.220+0000)
>
> Why would you play a dragon type when you have mega kangeskhan with sucker punch, and earthquake?

Wide Guard.
I thought Psychics were OP in Gen 1 though?

>maybe Gengars and that was about it.

There was a bug in gen 1 that made Psychics immune to Ghost moves rather than weak to them. Psychics actually had a huge advantage against Gengar since there moves had 2x effect (Gengar's part Poison) and they were immune to its STAB moves.

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=APAhcKhA,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-10-11T06:36:56.582+0000)
>
> There was a bug in gen 1 that made Psychics immune to Ghost moves rather than weak to them. Psychics actually had a huge advantage against Gengar since there moves had 2x effect (Gengar's part Poison) and they were immune to its STAB moves.

Except I believe Lick was the only ghost attack in gen 1. Night Shade is a fixed damage, so it's unreliable in PvP.

>Night Shade is a fixed damage, so it's unreliable in PvP.

Night Shade is strong on defensive Pokemon like Dusclops, since it often works out to be their highest damage option.

>Except I believe Lick was the only ghost attack in gen 1.

That's true, plus every bug move and Pokemon sucked which is basically why Psychic was so broken.

u mean cynthia's garchomp?

The fuck is you talking about? Dragon is hard countered by Ice. An Articuno, Lapras, or Dewgong can usually 1-shot any Dragon with just Ice Beam. Everyone knows Psychic is the best type their only weakness is Bug and Bug Type is literally one of the worst Types (i believe Grass is the weakest because most of them come with Poison creating a type with the most weakness and fewest strengths) as there a very few strong bug type attacks and none of the strong bug types even learn them naturally... Although if you wanna talk strongest overall pokemon (other then Mewtwo...) we can look at Tauros, that dude was a monster...
Yeah, they got their asses beat.

Uh, more like Psychic in the orginal Pokemon. Only weakness is a trick. Weak to bug and ghost types, but there were no strong bugs in the original and the only ghost was ghost poison so it got one shot by psychics that had better psychic moves than the best ghost moves.

SKT may look like they have weaknesses in theory, but they don't exist in matches.

P.S. C9 clearly not going to be David to slay the SKT. RIP the C9 dream after 0-4 day.

The old Dragon type used to suck major balls. Yeah, they resisted pretty much everything, but they only had 1 STAB move and it was fixed damage. They were more or less just slightly better Normal types
